ijp.picture

Class Picture

  • java.lang.Object
    • ijp.picture.Picture

  • public class Picture
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for retrieving images from resources folder and storing them in a HashMap.
    Author:
    Konstantinos Zacharis (s1569729@sms.ed.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Picture() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPicture(java.lang.String imageName, javafx.scene.image.Image path)
      Add new image to HashMap.
      void downloadPictures()
      If resources folder is empty automatically downloads a public link provided from Dropbox.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,javafx.scene.image.Image> getStoredPictures()
      Return the HashMap storedPictures.
      void jarPictureLoader()
      Enables to load the images into the jar and making it executable from any directory without having the resources folder.
      void pictureReader()
      Store image names and Images to HashMap, through iterating the folder "/resources", where images are originally stored.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Picture

        public Picture()

    • Method Detail

      • addPicture

        public void addPicture(java.lang.String imageName,
                       javafx.scene.image.Image path)
        Add new image to HashMap.
        Parameters:
        imageName - image name of the new image e.g.(#IMAGE_NAME_WITHOUT_EXTENSION#)
        path - the path of the new image e.g. (#file:resources/IMAGE_NAME_EXTENSION#)

      • downloadPictures

        public void downloadPictures()
        If resources folder is empty automatically downloads a public link provided from Dropbox. After the folder is created you need to click on the folder that will redirect you in the online public folder in Dropbox and download them from there in the resources folder.

      • jarPictureLoader

        public void jarPictureLoader()
        Enables to load the images into the jar and making it executable from any directory without having the resources folder.

      • pictureReader

        public void pictureReader()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Store image names and Images to HashMap, through iterating the folder "/resources", where images are originally stored.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throw IOException

      • getStoredPictures

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,javafx.scene.image.Image> getStoredPictures()
        Return the HashMap storedPictures.
        Returns:
        the HashMap storedPictures.
